Class Weapon

  • java.lang.Object
    • Product
      • Weapon
  • public class Weapon
extends Product
    Extends the product class, adding a "damage" field to represent the damage given by the weapon. Chains Weapon constructor to allow for damage field to be initialized from constructor.
    Since:
    11/19/21
    See Also:
    Product

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Weapon()
      Default constructor.
      Weapon​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String desc, double price, int qty, int damage)
      Constructor with args to initialize instance variables on construction of the Product.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getDamage()
      Returns damage value per hit.
      void setDamage​(int damage)
      Sets damage per hit caused by the weapon.

      • Methods inherited from class Product

        getDesc, getName, getPrice, getQty, setDesc, setName, setPrice, setQty, updatePrice, updateQty

    • Constructor Detail

      • Weapon

        public Weapon()
        Default constructor.

      • Weapon

        public Weapon​(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String desc,
              double price,
              int qty,
              int damage)
        Constructor with args to initialize instance variables on construction of the Product.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the product.
        desc - A brief description of the product.
        price - The current sell price of the product.
        qty - The quantity of the item in stock at the storefront.
        damage - The damage the weapon deals.

    • Method Detail

      • setDamage

        public void setDamage​(int damage)
        Sets damage per hit caused by the weapon.
        Parameters:
        damage - The damage value for the weapon, per hit.

      • getDamage

        public int getDamage()
        Returns damage value per hit.
        Returns:
        Damage per hit.
